1.title: Five Children and It

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: The Water-Babies

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

2.plot: How Edith Nesbit created a new kind of children's fiction, a blend of magic and realism.

1.title: Great Expectations

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

1.plot: Great Expectations has often been considered one of Charles Dickens's greatest works. EastEnders screenwriter Tony Jordan explores Dickens's success as a serial writer and how Dickens could never keep his own personal problems out of his novels.

2.title: Shakespeare's First Folio

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

2.plot: Actor Simon Russell Beale has dedicated most of his professional life to the work of one man: The Bard, William Shakespeare. In Shakespeare's time, original manuscripts were thrown away, so without The First Folio, many of Shakespeare's works would have been lost forever.

3.title: Mrs. Dalloway

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

3.plot: English writer Virginia Woolf is one of the most fascinating novelists of the twentieth century. Presenter Alexandra Harris explores Woolf's 1925 novel Mrs. Dalloway and how the writing reflected the unstable society following the World War One.

4.title: The Mabinogion

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

4.plot: The Mabinogion is a collection of 11 ancient folk tales that is considered Wales' most important contribution to European literature. Cerys Matthews explores the fascinating history of the collection and how it influenced fantasy such as J.R.R. Tolkien's Lord of the Rings.

5.title: Jane Eyre

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

5.plot: Novelist Bidisha Mamata first read Charlotte Brontë's Jane Eyre when she was a teenager and was captivated by Jane's liberating journey into adulthood. But upon revisiting the book, Bidisha challenges the romanticism of Brontë's classic novel.

6.title: Frankenstein

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

6.plot: Mary Shelley's Frankenstein has become synonymous monsters and the dangers of science without morals. Author and scientist Professor Alice Roberts returns to the original text to explore the myths of the novel and what Shelley originally intended Frankenstein to be about.

1.title: The Faerie Queene

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

1.plot: An explanation of the allegorical meaning behind Spenser's epic Renaissance poem

2.title: Edward Lear's Nonsense Songs

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

2.plot: Nicholas Parsons looks at "The Owl and the Pussycat" to explore the connection between joy and melancholy in Edward Lear's poetry.

3.title: The Mill on the Floss

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

3.plot: Fiona Shaw looks at George Eliot's famous novel in the context of Victorian debates on gender.

4.title: Confessions of an Opium Eater

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

4.plot: Looking at Thomas De Quincey's psychologically complex, semi-autobiographical work.

5.title: Cider with Rosie

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

5.plot: Looking at Laurie Lee's elegy to a disappearing world.

6.title: Swallows and Amazons

episode of.title: The Secret Life of Books (TV Series 2014– )

6.plot: How a former foreign correspondent created an authentic children's classic with real characters in recognizable places.

imdb.plot outline: Great Expectations, Jane Eyre, and Great Expectations are just a few of the classic works of fiction that we all know and love. But how well do we really know them? In this series, presenters revisit original manuscripts and diaries of the authors themselves to reveal new insights into classic literature.
imdb.title: The Secret Life of Books
